Garden with Classical Buildings and a Fountain

label: Description
value: Imaginary classical setting.  Fountain in pool at center of composition.  Three upside-down entwined dolphins support central jet.  Behind, on left and right, two reclinging figures with urns of water pouring into the pool.  Surrounding the pool are symmetrical arrangements of trees, terraces, and classical buildings.  Two female figures stand on terrace at right.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor, black chalk on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Tobias Christ; 1986: acquired by Museum (from Armin B. Allen, Inc., New York City)

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: Circular plate, concave center, scalloped rim. Upper surface painted in "Tobacco Leaf" pattern in pink, yellow, blue, with underglaze blue areas and gilded details. Reverse painted with underglaze blue and red floral sprigs.

label: Description
value: Length of fabric with a deep border of paisley shapes and a field of smaller paisley shapes. The fabric is three directional.

Blocks for field: 9 3/4 x 7 1/2 in. Label: block printed on cotton plain weave

label: Description
value: The central figure is a Bodhisattva made by needle looping in the 13th century. The figure was later sewn to a ground of Chinese light blue silk satin with a gold pattern of chrysanthemums on a curving vine. The standard is made from various woven silk and metallic brocades, sewn in tab-like forms to surround the Bodhisattva. A silk tassel finishes the bottom.

label: Object Type
value: Altar and altar component coverings and hangings

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal threads, paper Technique: the bodhisattva is needle looping technique; the hanging is made from various woven fabrics sewn together

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition Fund

label: Description

value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave; blue and black printed; orange and yellow immersion dyed. (One color is a development of the other probably using a chromate.); many block marks present; size of the repeat unit is probably not the size of the blocks; glaze still present

value: Warp x Weft: 96 x 63.5 cm (37 13/16 x 25 in.) Repeat H x W (size of unit of pattern repeat in offset (half-drop) alignment): 42.5 x 33 cm (16 3/4 in. x 13 in.)

label: Description
value: Letter written in French, dated May 8,1786 in Rouen, from Pievel Freres (manufacturers) to Poache Freres (shipowners?) at Havre concerning an order of 'blue guines' and suggesting the fabric might sell well at the Cape. On second page are four small swatches of blue resist.

label: Physical description
value: Technique: resist paste printed by block; immersion dyed in indigo to achieve two shades of blue

Design for a Bedroom Armoire in Louis XVI Style (Armoire pour un chambre à coucher riches, Style Louis XVI)

label: Description
value: Armoire with tall doors with elaborate carving and marquetry.  On tall center panel masks with plumed headdress are flanked by suspended musical trophies.  Below two putti holding musical instruments, seated upon a tri-partite banner.  Upper and lower panels decorated with hinges in acanthus leaf motif.  Top of armoire displays ewers with helmet spouts which flank a mounted potpourri vase.  Armoire is set in front of a carved wood paneled wall. Cast shadows throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, color pencil, brush and watercolor on cream paper

label: Description
value: Wall elevation for entrance hall in renaissance-revival style (although it is called "genre Boulle" in published drawing, see bibliography).  Lower portion consists of console decorated with panels with carved urns, masks and a garland.  Two metal (?) ewers flank a metal (?) covered vase on lower opening.  Central portion dominated by a large mirror with floral arrangement below, niches on either side decorated with caryatids on pilasters, cups in the mannerist style and tazzas below.  Upper portion consists of open pediment with covered cup and a demi-lune carving with cartouche and date (1873), flanked by volute-figures reclining on garlands of fruit, a covered cup on base at each end.  Cast shadows throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, color pencil, brush and watercolor on cream paper
Title page, "Insectes d'Europe, Pients d'apres nature," by J.J. Ernst
